resources.string:
v2.0.2:

New: French translation, thanks to Mickael (M2ck)!

New: Automatic day/night theme switching for the settings app and shortcut launcher.

New: Persistent mode, for those who are having problems with the widget not updating. Please note, this will add a persistent notification to your system notifications

Fixed: Alarm complication will now show 12 noon correctly when using 12-hour time format.

Fixed: The number 7 no longer shows overlapping sections when using transparent colors.

Fixed: Some strange behaviour in list dialogs.

Fixed: Several crashy things: - Workaround to compensate for some launchers reporting wrong dimensions when widget is resized.
 - Workaround to compensate for Samsung on some Samsung devices when requesting current wallpaper.
 - Better handling of invalid/corrupted touch shortcuts. - Two other minor fixes which each affected a single person.
 



v2.0.1 (February 2016):

New option to tweak automatic color-picking to prefer lighter/darker colors.

Fixed: Muzei wallpaper changes will now automatically force a color update.

Fixed: Touch shortcuts will no longer remove FORM from the Recents overview screen.
 



v2.0 (February 2016):
 Rebuilt from the ground up!


Optimized widget rendering code.


Much more flexible color options:
 - You can now pick any ARGB color, or pick one of the presets.
 - Separate color controls for outlines and complications.
 - Each color can now be 'locked' individually. --- Locked colors will stay the same no matter what wallpaper you use.
 --- Unlocked colors will be replaced by colors picked from your wallpaper.


Flexible new formatting options for the clock and any complications.


New option to change widget layout depending on device rotation


New option to change the frequency of color-syncing with your wallpaper. Choose a lower frequency to reduce system resource usage
 - You can always tap on the widget to force a resync.


You can now choose more than one app shortcut - if more than one is selected then tapping the widget will show you a launcher list to choose from, otherwise it will open the chosen app immediately.

Added a very basic Daydream. For now this is essentially an easter egg but will be improved on in future updates.

v2.0.d

Some users have had problems with the touch shortcut settings, so I have reimplemented that dialog. I was not able to replicate the error so this is mostly guesswork - if you have had issues before please let me know if this has fixed it for you!

- The shortcut menu is now sorted properly and shows package names to help you figure out which app called e.g. 'Clock' you actually want to use.

Added a very basic Daydream. It currently uses the same settings as the widget and can be a little wonky - optimization and customization will be implemented when possible.

Minor dialog animation tweaks.
 



v2.0.c (11 January 2016)

You can now choose the opacity of custom colors.


More formatting options:

- Explicitly choose 12- or 24-hour formatting to override your system settings.

- Removed restrictions on custom date formatting.

- Toggle for upper or lowercase in complication text.

- Optional zero-padding.

- Formatting options have moved to their own tab.


Unlocked color buttons now show a colored icon to show which color they have pulled from your wallpaper.


Fixed: weird looking complication text shadow on some devices

 



v2.0.b (16 November 2015)

Color patches now fade out when they are not in effect. Still not sure this is completely intuitive but it's better than before.


Fixed: The midnight hour now correctly shows as '12:xx' in 12-hour format.


Fixed: Color picker no longer gets weird when you click on an empty space. 


Fixed: Bug that could cause 2 options to be selected in 'Color update frequency' dialog.
 



v2.0.a (14 November 2015)
 Rebuilt from the ground up!


Optimised widget rendering code.


New option to change widget layout depending on device rotation.


Much more flexible color options:

- You can now make any RGB color, or pick one of the presets.

- Separate colour controls for outlines and complications.

- Each color can be 'locked' individually:

--- Locked colors will stay the same no matter what wallpaper you use.

--- Unlocked colors will be replaced by colours picked from your wallpaper.


New date formatting options.


New option to change the frequency of color-syncing with your wallpaper. Choose a lower frequency to reduce system resource usage. You can always touch the widget to force a color update.


You can now choose more than one app to open when you touch the widget. Tapping the widget will force a color update, regardless of other settings.

Thank you for helping me test this beta version of FORM Clock Widget.\n\n Please let me know if you have any crashes or unexpected oddities and I will do my best to sort them out quickly. Any other forms of feedback and requests are welcome too!
If you have any problems or requests please let me know and I will do what I can to help you.
